chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley W. Kroeplin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs unless prescription and only in the amount prescribed.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended by agent.  AODA and follow up.  DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
with huber for work, school, treatment or a combination.  No objection to EMP.   Court finds 212 day credit only if defendant is REVOKED.
Concurrent with: each other

records.addlTxt:
Case called:  11:43 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Peter Rotter;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 3 (Possession of a Controlled Substance)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possession of a Controlled Substance)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine (>10-50g)-PTAC))>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (Possess w/ Intent- THC (>200-1000g)-PTAC))>>DRI.
Ct. 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct. 9 (Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription-PTAC)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
  
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent- Amphetamine (>10-50g)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 2 (Possess w/ Intent- Heroin (<=3g)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent- Amphetamine (>10-50g)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation, concurrent to all Counts. CONDITIONS: 153 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended by agent, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from drugs unless prescription and only within the prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 212 Days Credit if Defendant is REVOKED.

Ct. 2 (Possess w/ Intent- Heroin (<=3g)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation, concurrent to all Counts. CONDITIONS: 153 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended by agent, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from drugs unless prescription and only within the prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 212 Days Credit if Defendant is REVOKED.

Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation, concurrent to all Counts. CONDITIONS: 153 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended by agent, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from drugs unless prescription and only within the prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 212 Days Credit if Defendant is REVOKED.

COURT does not modify bond at this time.
COURT ORDERS: Bond amount to remain the same. COURT Does not object to EMP if jail were to approve. If Defendant is allowed EMP, Conditions are to be Defendant is to live with parents, with exception of possibly work or medical appointments. Defendant would have to day report for drugs and alcohol. Same bond conditions would be required.
